alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 5:59PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Apache County through 745 PM MDT... At 659 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm over Chambers, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Springs, Window Rock, Sanders, Oak Springs Valley, Houck, Chambers and St. Michaels. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 332 and 359. State Route 264 between mile markers 470 and 475. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 389. Highway 191 161 between mile markers 354 and 368. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
